update.description:
Could we add this method to allow getting the current world SDF? This can be used alternatively to ``World::Save`` if something should be adjusted in the SDF before saving.

I need it to change the URIs to resources if I want to save the world in a directory along with its resources.
update.title: Added method World::GetSDF()

CI:

* [Xenial gpu](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/355/) - no related failures
* There seems to be something wrong with the Homebrew job
* Windows always fails

content.raw: Thanks for the test and for spotting the obsolete test. I agree that it is obsolete since sdf has been on its own repo for a long time, I vote for removing it.
content.html: Thanks for the test and for spotting the obsolete test. I agree that it is obsolete since sdf has been on its own repo for a long time, I vote for removing it.

content.raw:
I've added a simple test, thought it makes sense to put it in `sdf.cc`[,](http://sdf.cc) and while I was doing that I stumbled upon a presumably obsolete test. Thought I'd take this as an occasion to bring it up whether we should get rid of it, since the Param interface in sdformat has since changed, and such a test would anyway belong into sdformat.

Link to[ jenkins build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any/704/).
content.html:
I've added a simple test, thought it makes sense to put it in sdf.cc, and while I was doing that I stumbled upon a presumably obsolete test. Thought I'd take this as an occasion to bring it up whether we should get rid of it, since the Param interface in sdformat has since changed, and such a test would anyway belong into sdformat.

Link to jenkins build.

content.raw:
Hi @JenniferBuehler , thanks for migrating some changes to SDFormat! 

I think this is almost good to go, I think a simple test would be enough before merging it. Thanks!
content.html:
Hi @JenniferBuehler , thanks for migrating some changes to SDFormat!

I think this is almost good to go, I think a simple test would be enough before merging it. Thanks!

content.raw: You're always one step ahead ;) That has been merged!
content.html: You're always one step ahead ;) That has been merged!

content.raw: True, that's why I made [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/378/) :slight_smile:
content.html: True, that's why I made this pull request

content.raw: Thanks! If I remember correctly, Gazebo default is currently not building against SDF default though, so we'll probably have to wait for that to get figured out first.
content.html: Thanks! If I remember correctly, Gazebo default is currently not building against SDF default though, so we'll probably have to wait for that to get figured out first.

content.raw: After pull [request 372 in sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/372) has been merged, I have updated this to simply return the updated SDF element. It is now not wrapped any more, as discussed above we will only return the SDF. The user can then still use the wrapper function in sdformat to wrap the element.
content.html: After pull request 372 in sdformat has been merged, I have updated this to simply return the updated SDF element. It is now not wrapped any more, as discussed above we will only return the SDF. The user can then still use the wrapper function in sdformat to wrap the element.

content.raw:
Sorry for taking ages, I was unavailable in the past few weeks.

\+1 to moving this to sdformat. What do you think about the [suggestion in this PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/372/). Would this be the right place to add this helper to?

After we've finalised the addition to sdformat I'll apply the changes here accordingly. I suggest that for using this function in all other places we use a separate PR. I'm happy to create it as soon as we've agreed about the addition to sdformat.
content.html:
Sorry for taking ages, I was unavailable in the past few weeks.

+1 to moving this to sdformat. What do you think about the suggestion in this PR. Would this be the right place to add this helper to?

After we've finalised the addition to sdformat I'll apply the changes here accordingly. I suggest that for using this function in all other places we use a separate PR. I'm happy to create it as soon as we've agreed about the addition to sdformat.

content.raw: +1 to being consistent and to providing a wrapper.
content.html: +1 to being consistent and to providing a wrapper.

content.raw:
ya we often need the complete SDF spec, not just for world but for others as well. A quick search for `SDF_VERSION` string reveals we're doing this in many places. Maybe we could make that a helper function in the sdformat library. That requires a SDF release so it'll be outside of this PR. 

Do you already have code that makes use of this function? Maybe we can move the SDF wrapper logic there first?
content.html:
ya we often need the complete SDF spec, not just for world but for others as well. A quick search for SDF_VERSION string reveals we're doing this in many places. Maybe we could make that a helper function in the sdformat library. That requires a SDF release so it'll be outside of this PR.

Do you already have code that makes use of this function? Maybe we can move the SDF wrapper logic there first?

content.raw: Yup, sorry I often forget that when it's already explained in the `\brief` :wink: Added it.
content.html: Yup, sorry I often forget that when it's already explained in the \brief Added it.

update.description:
Could we add this method to allow getting the current world SDF? This can be used alternatively to ``World::Save`` if something should be adjusted in the SDF before saving.

I need it to change the URIs to resources if I want to save the world in a directory along with its resources.
update.title: Added method World::GetSDF()

content.raw:
Hmmm that's a good point. In many cases, the SDF of the world is probably needed to save (or otherwise use) the complete SDF specification, but you're right in that we should be consistent. Otherwise, the same should then also be used for `Model`, `Actor` and `Light`.

It would be good to have such a "sdf wrapper" method available though to get a complete valid SDF. This could be a helper function somewhere. `gazebo.hh/.cc` is probably too high-level for such a helper function... `common/CommonIFace.hh/.cc` does not have SDF dependencies yet and seems too general too. Or we could add a method `Base::SDFRoot()` which returns the root after calling `Base::GetSDF()`.

Any preferences or other ideas where such a helper method could be placed?
content.html:
Hmmm that's a good point. In many cases, the SDF of the world is probably needed to save (or otherwise use) the complete SDF specification, but you're right in that we should be consistent. Otherwise, the same should then also be used for Model, Actor and Light.

It would be good to have such a "sdf wrapper" method available though to get a complete valid SDF. This could be a helper function somewhere. gazebo.hh/.cc is probably too high-level for such a helper function... common/CommonIFace.hh/.cc does not have SDF dependencies yet and seems too general too. Or we could add a method Base::SDFRoot() which returns the root after calling Base::GetSDF().

Any preferences or other ideas where such a helper method could be placed?

content.raw: missing `\return`
content.html: missing \return

content.raw: Looking at other classes that provide a similar function for retrieving SDFs, e.g. [Base::GetSDF](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/96ab49d0550bcff5fc6c36a31ad6894bb687a13a/gazebo/physics/Base.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Base.cc-455), [Visual::GetSDF](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/96ab49d0550bcff5fc6c36a31ad6894bb687a13a/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Visual.cc-3269), we normally don't wrap it with a root SDF element. Not sure if we want to be consistent here
content.html: Looking at other classes that provide a similar function for retrieving SDFs, e.g. Base::GetSDF, Visual::GetSDF, we normally don't wrap it with a root SDF element. Not sure if we want to be consistent here

content.raw: That's much better of course, didn't know it exists. Thanks!
content.html: That's much better of course, didn't know it exists. Thanks!
